verses.kjv: I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience also bearing me witness in the Holy Ghost,
verses.ct: I am speaking the truth as someone united with Christ — I am not lying. My conscience, guided by the Holy Spirit, confirms this:

verses.kjv: That I have great heaviness and continual sorrow in my heart.
verses.ct: I carry an enormous grief and a pain in my heart that never goes away.

verses.kjv: For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh:
verses.ct: I would almost wish that I myself were cut off from Christ if it would help my brothers, my own people by blood —

verses.kjv: Who are Israelites; to whom pertaineth the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the giving of the law, and the service of God, and the promises;
verses.ct: the people of Israel. They were adopted as God's children. The glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the temple worship, and the promises all belong to them.

verses.kjv: Whose are the fathers, and of whom as concerning the flesh Christ came, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen.
verses.ct: The patriarchs are their ancestors, and from their lineage, in his human nature, Christ came — the one who is supreme over all, God praised forever. Amen.

verses.kjv: Not as though the word of God hath taken none effect. For they are not all Israel, which are of Israel:
verses.ct: But this doesn't mean that God's word has failed. Because not everyone descended from Israel truly belongs to Israel.

verses.kjv: Neither, because they are the seed of Abraham, are they all children: but, In Isaac shall thy seed be called.
verses.ct: And not all of Abraham's descendants are truly his children. Instead, God said, 'Your true descendants will come through Isaac.'

verses.kjv: That is, They which are the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God: but the children of the promise are counted for the seed.
verses.ct: What this means is that physical descendants are not automatically God's children. Rather, it is the children born because of God's promise who are counted as the true descendants.

verses.kjv: For this is the word of promise, At this time will I come, and Sarah shall have a son.
verses.ct: Because here is what the promise said: 'At the appointed time I will return, and Sarah will have a son.'

verses.kjv: And not only this; but when Rebecca also had conceived by one, even by our father Isaac;
verses.ct: And that's not the only example. Rebecca also became pregnant with twins by one man — our ancestor Isaac.

verses.kjv: (For the children being not yet born, neither having done any good or evil, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him that calleth;)
verses.ct: Before the children were even born, and before they had done anything good or bad, God made a statement — so that his purpose based on his own choosing would stand firm, depending not on what people do but on the one who calls —

verses.kjv: It was said unto her, The elder shall serve the younger.
verses.ct: she was told, 'The older will serve the younger.'

verses.kjv: As it is written, Jacob have I loved, but Esau have I hated.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, 'I loved Jacob, but I rejected Esau.'

verses.kjv: What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? God forbid.
verses.ct: So what do we conclude? That God is unfair? Absolutely not!

verses.kjv: For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.
verses.ct: God told Moses, 'I will show mercy to whoever I choose to show mercy, and I will have compassion on whoever I choose to have compassion on.'

verses.kjv: So then it is not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth, but of God that sheweth mercy.
verses.ct: So it doesn't depend on human desire or effort — it depends on God, who shows mercy.

verses.kjv: For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up, that I might shew my power in thee, and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth.
verses.ct: Scripture records God saying to Pharaoh, 'This is the very reason I raised you up — to demonstrate my power through you, and so that my name would be proclaimed across the entire earth.'

verses.kjv: Therefore hath he mercy on whom he will have mercy, and whom he will he hardeneth.
verses.ct: So then, God shows mercy to whoever he wants, and he hardens whoever he wants.

verses.kjv: Thou wilt say then unto me, Why doth he yet find fault? For who hath resisted his will?
verses.ct: You might ask me, 'Then why does God still blame anyone? Who can possibly resist what he decides?'

verses.kjv: Nay but, O man, who art thou that repliest against God? Shall the thing formed say to him that formed it, Why hast thou made me thus?
verses.ct: But who are you — a mere human — to talk back to God? Can something that was shaped say to the one who shaped it, 'Why did you make me this way?'

verses.kjv: Hath not the potter power over the clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another unto dishonour?
verses.ct: Doesn't the potter have the right to take the same lump of clay and form one piece for an honored purpose and another for an ordinary one?

verses.kjv: What if God, willing to shew his wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much longsuffering the vessels of wrath fitted to destruction:
verses.ct: What if God, wanting to display his anger and demonstrate his power, patiently put up with objects of his anger that were destined for destruction?

verses.kjv: And that he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy, which he had afore prepared unto glory,
verses.ct: And what if he did this to reveal the incredible richness of his glory to the objects of his mercy, which he prepared in advance for glory —

verses.kjv: Even us, whom he hath called, not of the Jews only, but also of the Gentiles?
verses.ct: meaning us, the ones he called, not only from among the Jews but also from among the Gentiles?

verses.kjv: As he saith also in Osee, I will call them my people, which were not my people; and her beloved, which was not beloved.
verses.ct: As God says through Hosea: 'I will call those who were not my people "my people," and the one who was not loved I will call "my loved one."'

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that in the place where it was said unto them, Ye are not my people; there shall they be called the children of the living God.
verses.ct: 'In the very place where they were told, "You are not my people," they will be called children of the living God.'

verses.kjv: Esaias also crieth concerning Israel, Though the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant shall be saved:
verses.ct: Isaiah also cries out about Israel: 'Even if the number of Israel's descendants is as vast as the sand on the seashore, only a remnant will be saved.

verses.kjv: For he will finish the work, and cut it short in righteousness: because a short work will the Lord make upon the earth.
verses.ct: Because the Lord will carry out his sentence on the earth completely and decisively in righteousness.'

verses.kjv: And as Esaias said before, Except the Lord of Sabaoth had left us a seed, we had been as Sodoma, and been made like unto Gomorrha.
verses.ct: And as Isaiah predicted earlier, 'If the Lord of Armies had not preserved some of our descendants for us, we would have ended up like Sodom and become like Gomorrah.'

verses.kjv: What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, which followed not after righteousness, have attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith.
verses.ct: So what do we conclude? That Gentiles, who were not pursuing righteousness, actually obtained it — the righteousness that comes through faith.

verses.kjv: But Israel, which followed after the law of righteousness, hath not attained to the law of righteousness.
verses.ct: But Israel, who pursued a law aimed at righteousness, never achieved it.

verses.kjv: Wherefore? Because they sought it not by faith, but as it were by the works of the law. For they stumbled at that stumblingstone;
verses.ct: Why not? Because they pursued it through works instead of through faith. They tripped over the stumbling stone.

verses.kjv: As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, 'Look, I am placing in Zion a stone that causes people to stumble, a rock that makes them fall. But whoever puts their trust in him will never be put to shame.'
